custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)

reported-by-record.description:

defect.summary: Xian 12 does not enumerate if plugged into a 3.0 hub after plugging in the Baron USB keyboard.

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
Plug a USB 3.0 hub (4-port USB 3.0 Internal/External Hub 3.5" front panel) into a 2.0 USB port on a Dell XPS laptop (262) on W7 Ultimate SP1. Plug in the keyboard into the hub. Confirm it enumerates and works. Plug in the Xian 12 mouse into the hub. The device does not enumerate. The LED on the hub flickers, the mouse does not work.
Unplug the keyboard and the mouse starts to work.
This issue seems to occur with Wave Business, and Xian 12 mouse on a USB 3.0 hub. The issue occurred with the Diamond and USRobotics USB 3.0 hub also. The issue occurred on WXP, WVista and W7.
The issue does not occur with a D-Link 2.0 hub. The issue does not occur with the USB 3.0 hub + Baron USB + G9 USB. The issue does not occur with the USB 3.0 hub + Baron USB + Logitech Gaming Mouse G500
Note: Bug #4846 was logged for issue with 3.0 hubs on Mac.

defect-event.notes: System event generated by rule [Notify assigned person] Actions: Send email to users [Wang, Terence] using template [Defect Assignment]

On Mac when Xian mouse is plugged in 3.0 hub after Baron keyboard, the mouse enumerates and works fine. But if you reboot the machine and press shift key to go to safe mode, the mouse stops working after that. On iMac (sys 208) running 10.6.7, the mouse doesn't work even after unplug and replug on same and different port of the hub. After unplug and replug the keyboard, it also stops working. On older iMac (sys 139) running 10.5.8, the mouse sometimes starts working after unplug/replug in same or different port but sometimes it doesn't work.

On system 252 running XPP 64 SP2: When Xian mouse is plugged in after Baron keyboard, both keyboard and mouse enumerate and work fine. After the system restart, the mouse stops working. Need to unplug and replug the hub to fix the issue.

defect.summary: Shen: On 10.7 Mac, left click sometimes does not work to make a selection in expose-all apps

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
On 10.7 (11A494a) press a button assigned to Expose-all apps (usually button 4) and it tiles all the open windows. When you click on any window to make a selection, the click sometimes doesn't work with Shen. This happens approximately 50% of the time with Shen. If you clicked on all apps button 10 times in a row, about 5 times the click will not work to select an app. Several clicks are needed in this case to actually make a selection. This issue is not reproducible at all with Apple mighty mouse. Tried with other Logitech mice Scope 09, Flores and Borneo - the issue is reproducible with these as well but with lesser frequency (3 out of 10 times).
Note: Since Lion (10.7) OS is not released yet and this is a pre-release version, this could be a bug with the OS itself. Need to test again with released Lion build.
reported-by-record.steps-to-reproduce: -Connect Shen to a Lion machine (tested on iMac system 208) -Verify mouse is working -Launch several apps like Safari, textedit, system preferences etc -Click on button 4 (verify that button 4 is assigned to expose-all apps in system preferences) -When all apps are tiled on desktop, click on any app to select it =>notice sometimes the selection can't be made with first click. Few (3-4) clicks are needed to actually make a selection

defect.summary: Unicron:One sample function abnormal

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
On CN-007-L,W7U32SP1,one Unicron sample function abnormal,the other two samples are ok.All of them are PB3 samples with B16.Please see below detail information for the issue: 1.Power on the PC and key in password to enter the desktop,during the desktop was still loading, plug in the KBD,when finish loading and check KBD function, found the keys"W,A,S,D" and arrow key no function,the backlight is off and press the adjust key is no use.Unplug and replug in can recover. 2.Follow the same step to check another two KBD and no found issue 3.Then recheck the sample and no found issue 4.Later I found one way to reproduce the issue(100% duplication): 1)unplug the KBD 2) restart the PC 3)when there are something show in the screen then plug in the KBD 4)enter password interface and found KBD no function 5)enter password using notebook's KBD and enter desktop,open notepad to check function and found keys"W,A,S,D" and arrow key no function,the backlight is off and press the adjust key is no use;Sometimes after restart, the first key(any one key) pressed caused the windows help pop out. 6)Follow step 1) to 5) for other two samples and no found issue.
Also can duplicate the issue for the sample on CN-006-L Toshiba V32US2 when plug in the KBD during PC is starting;checked one good sample that has no such issue. On CN-004-L Lenovo V32US2,found the KBD function also abnormal,but which is different to above.Press power button to start PC and enter desktop,then plug in the KBD,KBD no function and backlight off, pop out windows help and search window, and the search windows always fresh and can not stop until unplug the KBD and wait a moment.Then repeat the steps again,after enter desktop, plug in the KBD,found only the "Window" key has function, other keys no function.Unplug it and plug in a good sample,it worked well,then unplug the good sample and replug in it,it worked well now.

defect.summary: Goldie defect unit (Data received from LLE with bit5 set to 0)

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description: It seems that all the data received from the LLE by the 8051 have the bit 5 set to 0. For example if the following message is received from the air "0x10 0x01 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF 0xFF", the message received is (0x10 0x01 0xDF 0xDF 0xDF 0xDF 0xDF) The register used to read the data is the SFR register RFD (0xD9) All other parts of the chip work well , USB is correct, right enumeration .... and radio seems also working well (writing in the channel register set a new radio channel). The issue seems only a Read internal issue between the LLE and the 8051

Test done (automatic tests): -Press a key each 2h15-30 (HIDoff) and measure the latencies: Latencies Result - 8 measurements: MIN 1621.09 ms AVG 3269.813 ms MAX 4426.42 ms -Restart the computer, press a key. Latencies Result - > 1000 measurements MIN 1592.28 ms AVG 3593.053 ms MAX 6027.99 ms

defect-event.notes: System event generated by rule [Notify Rupa of new bug reports] Actions: Send email to users [Murdeshwar, Rupa] using template [Defect Added]

After more investigation, it turns out that this behavior is implemented in the Apple Keyboard Firmware itself, not the driver.
Also, there's evidence that a lot of users despise this feature and wish that it didn't exist. The most common solution for these people is to buy a different / external keyboard (e.g. a Logitech one). It would be ironic, it we then had the same 'issue'...
I would recommend to NOT implement this for our keyboards.

defect.summary: SW: FW should send both the Ctrl code and the UpArrow code in the same HID report

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
After talking with EricTD in regards to the key sequence sent for Ctrl-UpArrow, I think we have an issue: In order to detect this sequence with a high degree of confidence, the FW should send both the Ctrl code and the UpArrow code in the same HID report.
Build 1 of the FW, doesn't do that yet. Hence I have to put in some timestamps for each event and use some fuzzy logic to detect a Ctrl-UpArrow (and distinguish it from a user-generated Ctrl + UpArrow).
Here's some debug output of the driver; it prints the HID reports right after they have entered the driver stack (before HID parsing takes place): I'm pressing and releasing E4 (F4's special function):
kernel[0]: com_Logitech_HIDEventDriver::handleInterruptReport for PID:0x8502: (len: 9) 0x01 0x01 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 kernel[0]: com_Logitech_HIDEventDriver::handleInterruptReport for PID:0x8502: (len: 9) 0x01 0x01 0x00 0x52 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 kernel[0]: com_Logitech_HIDEventDriver::handleInterruptReport for PID:0x8502: (len: 9) 0x01 0x01 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 kernel[0]: com_Logitech_HIDEventDriver::handleInterruptReport for PID:0x8502: (len: 9) 0x01 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00
I would have expected to only see line #2 and line #4, like this:
kernel[0]: com_Logitech_HIDEventDriver::handleInterruptReport for PID:0x8502: (len: 9) 0x01 0x01 0x00 0x52 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 kernel[0]: com_Logitech_HIDEventDriver::handleInterruptReport for PID:0x8502: (len: 9) 0x01 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00
Of course, the report clearing the key should only be sent, once the key itself has been released. Thanks, roland

defect.summary: SW: Battery status
defect.workaround: Ignore meaningless additional bytes in HID report

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
Build 1 of the FW currently exposes a TLC (TopLevelCollection) for the battery status as a 1-byte field with UP:0x6 U:0x20, to be reported inside a report with report ID 3.
I've been able to solicit such a report only once so far. When I got it, it was 8 bytes long (1 byte for Report Id, 1 byte for battery status, 6 extra bytes that I didn't expect, with random content). I would expect a report with just 2 bytes. In comparison, report ID 1 reports are 9 bytes long, and report ID 2 reports are 5 bytes long. These values correspond exactly to the declared TLC sizes in the HID Descriptor.
Questions at this point: Is the report too long? Is the FW sending too many bytes? When is this report being sent? Do I have to actively poll for it? Should I rely on the FW to send periodic updates? Can I press the QueryBatteryStatus button (F8) to force sending such a report? (I didn't see anything in the GPS clarifying this). What is the best way to test that I'm getting the proper battery values? Should I use the keyboard with covered solar panels for a while and observe the value to decrease? Can I shine a very bright light into the solar panels and observe the value to increase? Converting the 0..255 value into a 0..100 percentage according to the triple linearization as specified in the GPS is clear and no problem.
Thanks, roland

defect.summary: Doubled characters appear quite often

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

defect-event.notes: System event generated by rule [Notify Rupa of new bug reports] Actions: Send email to users [Murdeshwar, Rupa] using template [Defect Added]
System event generated by rule [Notify assigned person] Actions: Send email to users [Salathé, Jean] using template [Defect Assignment]

Simple check, typing "4321" very fast (likely 20 keys per second at least, could be more) by bursts:
BABYPHOTON : 4321 43321 4321 43221 43212 43212 43221 4321 43212 43221 433221 4321 43231 43221 Catastrophic !
then I tried on Photon: 431 431 431 431 431 431 431
There is obviously a ghost kkey on 4321... So I switched to 5432 instead, on Photon: 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 5432 Perfect !
Then back to BabyPhoton: 54342 5432 54332 5432 5432 544323 5432 54342 54323 5432 5432 5432 54342 5432 543432 5432 544323 543423 543423 543432 54342 5432 544322 Catastrophic again !
Note : As I got a ghost combination on Photon, it means that I am making a 3-keys rollover with my fingers, could be interesting if we want to reproduce it manually.
Conclusion: it will be useful to characterize Broadcom's deboucing using ellectroniic switches. I would recommend to not only measure it the standard way (a variable pulse length) but also with a double pulse, to check for which timing they start to see two keys instead of one.

Should be OK with new debouncing values 5ms / 25ms I have however seen a few key repeat (not keys doubled, real long repeats like thisssssssssssssssssssssssssss) that I had not seen before. Not statistically significant so far though.

defect.summary: Keys appear on the screen one or two seconds later after typing

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
Latencies measured with MacMini at logon: MIN: 19,17 ms AVG: 2470,7 ms MAX: 6317,25 Number of measurements: 2630.
Reconnection. Later on, when typing normally for instance "abc", nothing happens, then about one to two seconds later, "abc" appeared on PC screen. This behaviour was consistently reproducible (time does not solve it). A pairing to an iPhone, then the same try, showed the sameL: keystrokes were apparently sent with a long delay, as if keyboard was waiting for the 2s poll. Powering keyboard off then on solved the problem.

defect.summary: Sleep timeout of 2 hours is not implemented correctly

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

custom-field-value.field-value: Battery - Power mode consumption & Transition Test

reported-by-record.description:
Right before to close the bug I asked you to released this afternoon (TTP#5110 : Sleep timeout of 2 hours is not implemented correctly), I noticed that my Reda Build 0009 sample seemed not to fall in HID OFF mode after 2 hours without stimulation. I then re-did the test on 2 samples with Build 0008 and 0009 to compare. Results attached show that this timing seems to vary quit a lot so would you mind to take a look at it again. I can tell if it is fluctuating that much on each sample or not but seems anyway that something is not quiet right.
Build 0009 : It takes around 10417 seconds so 2 hours and 53 minutes to fall in HID OFF. Build 0008 : It takes around 14947 seconds so 4 hours and 9 minutes to fall in HID OFF.
we have found the problem that prevent Reda to fall in HID OFF after 2 hours.
This is due to battery level change notification which are sent out. This notification resets the "HID OFF timeout" every time a tiny voltage change is detected. In our setup with use a power supply which is supposed to be really stable but we still see the problem so imagine when the device is working on battery that is discharging constantly, it might never go in HID OFF.
To correct this problem the person who can help you to fix it is Jean Salathe. He is the person that already identified this bug on Baby Photon and know how to fix it so I let you check with him.
******************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************* Power modes test has shown that sleep timeout is not implemented correctly. It takes around 2h and 51 min (10270 s) instead of 2h to get disconnected. It also seems that current consumption while in disconnection mode (~ 60 uA) is a way above what expected.
All power modes test done : From power off to power on then 3 hours with no user action and iPad set to never falls in sleep mode see attachement for details.
Notes://CH01D02/C125782D004ADA4E/67D404C357967B0CC12577B2003D7573/04F1001DEC23AB01C12579B2004829D4

I have found one situation, that leads to KB dead until reset (Build 09) 1. KB connected and worked 2. Press on Connect button 3. Put KB at off position 4. Press on any key (this step is important) 5. PUt KB to on position, cannot connect the KB anymore by pressing on keys 6. "Forget device" to remove KB from list 7. Don't see KB anymore even if turning BT OFF/ON 8. Wait 3 minutes time out 9. Press on Connect button, can not put KB to discoverable mode anymore even if changing position. 10. Need to reset KB.

defect.summary: Battery life :Still lower than expected due to higher current consumption during HID OFF

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
Update March 06 2012 - RBK14_Reda Build 0005
Expected Battery Life (PRD/GPS) =11 months with Tablet Model Measured Battery Life = 2409.56 hours -> 100.39 days -> 3.3 months
Fill capacity information: Capacity at cutoff = 500 mAh
RESULT : FAILED .. while in HID OFF current is around 343 uA during around 12 hours 40 min then 36 uA during 7 hours and 22 min. See atatched files and capture
******************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************** RBK14_Reda Build 0004
Expected Battery Life (PRD/GPS) = 11 months with Tablet Model Measured Battery Life = 2065.46 hours -> 86 days -> 2.82 months
Fill capacity information: Capacity at cutoff = 500 mAh
RESULT : FAILED
As attached files show there is current consumption issue. When in HID OFF mode (13750 s (3.81 hour) instead of 2h timeout) current is around 367 uA . Something about 10 times what it should. After a while current consumption is dropped to 64 ua which is still to high anyway.

defect.summary: FW Cut off, LED and behavior issues

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
************************************************** Update March 14 2012 Build 0009 **************************************************
Regarding this bug on Build 0009 here is what I noticed :
If keyboard is turn on with power from 3.3 V to 3.1 and you start to type right after you turn on the device before red led goes on solid for 2 seconds, typed keys are reported. Keyboard works as in low battery mode no FW cut off happens. I feel like by typing at power on, battery level measurement is skipped. HW cut off shuts down the device at 2.98 V.
This is a P2 bug now.
************************************************** First bug entry ************************************************** If you turn on device at 3.3 V (battery reaplce by current sensor) ( same behavior noticed down to 3.15V) there are different inappropriate behaviors described below.
1. Turn device on at 3.3 V after around 1 second both led, red en green, blink once then nothing else if you let the keyboard quiet. Current consumption is around 36 uA
2. Turn device on at 3.3 V after around 1 second both led, red en green, blink once now if you start to type on the keyboard both leds go solid on again "forever" and no key is reported. Current consumption is around 4.55 mA
3. Turn device on at 3.3V and start to type right away, both led go on but green switched off and only red goes on for 2 or 3 seconds. While if finaly goes off then typed keys are reported and keyboard works as in low battery mode. I feel like by typing at power on, battery level measurement is skipped.- Current consumption is around 64 uA when no key typed.
In those 3 cases if power keep on falling then HW cut off shuts down the device around 2.98V. During this I saw all 3 LEDs lit.

defect.summary: Battery notifications issue : No PWM heartbeat but red LED blinking and wrong implementation

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
GPS says :
4.2.1.3.1 Low battery Heart Beat V1.2 (BT Keyboards)
Low battery heart beat V1.2 (KEYBOARD): Heart Beat is triggered by the following conditions: Battery is level is critical AND device just came out of deep sleep (disconnected) mode. Heart Beat is displayed during 20 seconds from the moment the device is left inactive for more than 2 seconds. After the 20 seconds display period, Heart Beat shall be stopped during the non-visible state. LED colour is RED
In Reda case :
When Battery level is critical AND device just came out of deep sleep (disconnected) mode : I got 2 sec solid RED led, then blue LED for Bluetooth reconnection which has priority over battery notifications, instead of 20 sec RED heartbeat. 1 min and 4 seconds later RED led blinking starts and stops only if keyboard get disconnected.
The heartbeat is not really implemented. No PWM. I would rather call this a red blinking LED.

defect.summary: Battery LED indicator lit on BT reconnection

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
None battery LED indication should be diplayed on the BT reconnection.
The right behaviour on reconnection should be:
BLUE LED starts to blink slow (500ms on, 500ms off) for 5s. As soon as BT state is connected, BLUE LED is lit solid for 5s. But if after the 5s reconnection timeout the BT connection is still not established, BLUE LED is turned OFF and device enters DISCONNECTED (HID OFF) mode. Any key pressed will restart the reconnection process.

defect.summary: Pairing does not start when making a long press on BT keys

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
Keyboard can enter into a state where a long press on BT key does not start pairing at all. There is the short blink showing the BT key press, then nothing else. When key is released several seconds after, nothing happens either. This happens with the 3 BT keys.
When pressing CONNECT, all 3 LEDs are blinking fast (OK) Pressing B1 key makes the LED blinking SLOWLY a 1 or 2 times, then it stops
Pressing CONNECT again - all 3 LEDs are blinking fast (OK) Pressing B2 key makes the LED blinking SLOWLY 5 times, then it stops (BUG)
Pressing CONNECT again - all 3 LEDs are blinking fast (OK) Pressing B3 key makes the LED blinking FAST for X minutes (OK) Pressing B1 key makes it blinking 2 times then it stops (BUG)
Pressing CONNECT again - all 3 LEDs are blinking fast (OK) Pressing B3 key makes the LED blinking FAST for X minutes (OK) Pressing B2 key makes it blinking FAST for X minutes (OK) Pressing B1 key makes it blinking 2 times then it stops (BUG)
Pressing CONNECT again - all 3 LEDs are blinking fast (OK) Make the BT connection on PC - OK, keyboard is paired on BT2 Now making a long press on B1 key makes it working correctly (starting pairing)

defect.summary: Timing is not correct when pressing a key to reconnect KB.

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
Timing is not correct when pressing a key to reconnect KB.
Note: There are 3 cases, all are not correct below.
reported-by-record.steps-to-reproduce:
Case 1: Reconnection is not successful 1. Connect KB to an ipad and check it works 2. Turn off BT on ipad 3. Put KB on desk or media position 4. Led is on for one time (battery status) + 5 times during reconnection 5. Reconnection is not successful 6. Press a key 7. Led is on for one time (battery status) + 2 times during reconnection------> wrong Note: According to GPS, it should be on 5 times to show reconnection status without showing battery status.
Case 2: Reconnection successful 1. Press a key to reconnect 2. Reconnection is successful 3. Led is lighted twice Note: Should be once.
Case 3. Reconnection is successful when Battery is below 3.375v
1. Press a key to reconnect 2. Reconnection is successful 3. Red Led is lighted twice Note: 1. Should be once. 2. If battery is above critical level, green led lighted twice.

See analysis done with Philippe C.: https://docs.google.com/a/logitech.com/#folders/0ByWX8eXLnLeqM0dFaU8yLU9TcUd3YWZlX0h0VklMZw
For information: If 2 BT MAC devices are connected but OFF, BabyPhoton does not connect at logon.
-> BabyPhoton stays diconnected. -> Wait ~5min and press keys on BabyPhoton then it reconnects.
Reproductible on MacBook Pro. Test not done on other MAC as much as been sold.
reported-by-record.steps-to-reproduce:
1. Pair BabyPhoton. 2. Pair 1 BT MAC TrackPad and 1 BT MAC KB (or 2 BT MAC TrackPad or 2 BT MAC KB). 3. Power OFF the BT MAC TrackPad and the BT MAC KB 4. Shutdown the MAC 5. Start the MAC at logon press a key to enter your password 6. BabyPhoton stays in disconnect mode. 7. Impossible to enter the Psw. You have to wait few minutes than you can enter the Psw.
See the different cases tested:

defect.summary: Pair babyphoton to iPad with B1, then pair babyphoton to Xoom tablet on B2. BabyPhoton no longer works at all on iPad.

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

attachment.name: Switch from Xoom to Android (wo 0x10 and 0x11) no more bug.btt

reported-by-record.description:
Setup: Xoom: Android 3.2 & Android 4.0 IPad3
1. Pair babyphoton to iPad with B1, then pair babyphoton to Xoom tablet on B2. Baby photon no longer works at all on iPad and must be repaired to the iPad to work. Both B1 and B2 work with Xoom. 2.Pair babyphoton to Xoom tablet with B1, then pair iPad to B2. Babyphoton works as intended and I can toggle between devices with no problem
Reproducible: On many Android devices

defect-event.notes: System event generated by rule [Notify Rupa of new bug reports] Actions: Send email to users [Murdeshwar, Rupa] using template [Defect Added]
System event generated by rule [Notify assigned person] Actions: Send email to users [Meisser, Mathieu] using template [Defect Assignment]

Upon BabyPhoton is reconnected, XOOM is sending an autorelease on every collection delared by the SDP: 01 00 00 00 ... 02 00 00 00 03 00 04 00 05 00 FF 00 10 00 00 ... 11 00 00 ...
10 and 11 are sent consecutively w/o repsecting the command/response sequence. By removing the collection 0x10 and 0x11 from the SDP declaration, the bug can't be reproduced. We have tried to send the 0x10,0x11 autorelease manually, the bug was still there.
So at that point, it seems that the fact these 2 commands are sent w/o waiting for the response is the best approach to found this issue out.
System event generated by rule [Notify assigned person] Actions: Send email to users [Douvé, Myriam] using template [Defect Assignment]
Bug is corrected with build 9812

issue to be reviewed for similar products

custom-field-value.field-value: Battery - Power mode consumption & Transition Test

reported-by-record.description:
Current stays at 2MA after power on & connection when we type keys during reconnection.
Same bug on Sunbook: #5088
I can not reproduce this bug with MacOS -> Tested with Lion & MacBook Air
After more than 2 hours BabyPhoton does NOT go in HIDoff
reported-by-record.steps-to-reproduce:
1. Power on Babyphoton 2. Type keys during connection. 3. The current stays at about 2MA until OFF/ON KB or BT OFF/ON of the host.

defect-event.notes: System event generated by rule [Notify Rupa of new bug reports] Actions: Send email to users [Murdeshwar, Rupa] using template [Defect Added]
System event generated by rule [Notify assigned person] Actions: Send email to users [Salathé, Jean] using template [Defect Assignment]
Traces are added. Same bug on SunBook.
After 2 hours, BabyPhoton does NOT go in HIDoff

M/S slave switch request is not sent by the keyboard when the bug is reproduced. The keyboard stays as the master with a 22.5 ms polling rate transmitted by it. This is at least the reason why the power consumption is so high in that case compare to an asymetric sniff.
2 files showing the bud are added BabyPhoton No MS switch 1.btt BabyPhoton No MS switch 2.btt
Nothing else before in the trace seems different as other traces when the M/S switch is sent.
To determine the root cause, I would suggest a special FW which sent automatically some keys when the FW is running
No more problem with build 16

defect.summary: [Edgepad] cursor jump @ low speed

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
When moving cursor at low speed after 3 seconds of inactivity from the touchpad, we do observe a jump backwards on the cursor. This happens only when going in the negative direction and on the X axis. See video attached.
Log from app rawxDec and rawxHex are respectively the x raw information from the sensor expressed in decimal and hex. DeltaX is is the computed relative displacement between two samples sent to the OS.
rawxDec = 2117 rawxHex = 845---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2112 rawxHex = 840---- DeltaX = -4 rawxDec = 2108 rawxHex = 83c---- DeltaX = -3 rawxDec = 2104 rawxHex = 838---- DeltaX = -4 rawxDec = 2099 rawxHex = 833---- DeltaX = -3 rawxDec = 2096 rawxHex = 830---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2090 rawxHex = 82a---- DeltaX = -4 rawxDec = 2087 rawxHex = 827---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2084 rawxHex = 824---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2081 rawxHex = 821---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2078 rawxHex = 81e---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2112 rawxHex = 840---- DeltaX = 22 rawxDec = 2096 rawxHex = 830---- DeltaX = -10 rawxDec = 2095 rawxHex = 82f---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2085 rawxHex = 825---- DeltaX = -8 rawxDec = 2078 rawxHex = 81e---- DeltaX = -6 rawxDec = 2073 rawxHex = 819---- DeltaX = -4 rawxDec = 2073 rawxHex = 819---- DeltaX = -1 rawxDec = 2049 rawxHex = 801---- DeltaX = -16 rawxDec = 2047 rawxHex = 7ff---- DeltaX = -2 rawxDec = 2032 rawxHex = 7f0---- DeltaX = -11 rawxDec = 2023 rawxHex = 7e7---- DeltaX = -7 rawxDec = 2017 rawxHex = 7e1---- DeltaX = -4 rawxDec = 2017 rawxHex = 7e1---- DeltaX = -1 rawxDec = 1991 rawxHex = 7c7---- DeltaX = -17 rawxDec = 1978 rawxHex = 7ba---- DeltaX = -10 rawxDec = 1971 rawxHex = 7b3---- DeltaX = -4 rawxDec = 1967 rawxHex = 7af---- DeltaX = -4
For the Video 1664, at t=6s the problem occurs.
reported-by-record.steps-to-reproduce: #1) Wait 3 seconds #2) Make a few centimeters displacement to the left (X minus) #3) Observe cursor glitch or repeat to #1

defect.summary: Non-stop key repeat on Ipad 2 with Baby Photon

custom-field-value.field-name: Info provided (Check after requested info has been provided)
issue to be reviewed for similar products
Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.description:
Non-stop key repeat with Baby Photon build 11 on Ipad 2. The key repeat keeps going even after the keyboard is turned off. The key repeat continues even after you move to another host.
Host 1: Ipad attached to Sunbook. Host 2: Mac Mini Host 3: Xoom
I was toggling between different hosts. Suddenly when i started typing on Ipad, a key started repeating. There was a non-stop repeat of every key i pressed. I turned the keyboard off but the key repeat continued .. Pressed a key with the keyboard turned off but there was no input of any keys i pressed. The previous key repeat continued. I moved to another host and started typing. It was fine, however the key repeat on IPad contined... Finally, it stopped on pressing a key on Sunbook. The Sunbook was connected to the Ipad but i was not using it. After that, everything was working fine again!
I could reproduce the issue twice.

Test Case that found the bug

reported-by-record.steps-to-reproduce: I boot the Mac Before entering the password on the Mac I pressed B1? key (to connect to my iPhone) I pressed the Bluetooth button on the bottom The 3 leds were blinking I tried again to press the B1? key I initiated the connection from the iPhone The keyboard connected to the iPhone on B2 I used the keyboard on the iPhone I tried to switch to B3 to enter the password on the Mac, no blue led Each time I press one of the Bx key, the iPhone screen wakes up After a link loss, the led restart to work but still impossible to be connected on MacOS.
